etymology.description: 朿(朿) (cì, "thorn") duplicated = representation of a thorny fruit -> jujube
etymology.interpretation: 棗(棗) captures the essence of the jujube fruit as it is associated with thorns, likely highlighting its tree's thorny branches or protective nature.
etymology.simplification: 棗(棗) simplified by reducing 朿(朿) (cì, "thorn") to a simpler form ⺀ in 枣(枣).

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃枣(我喜歡吃棗)。
秋天成熟时(秋天成熟時)，树上挂满枣(樹上掛滿棗)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān chéngshú shí, shù shàng guà mǎn zǎo.
examples.english: When autumn ripens, the trees are laden with jujubes.

examples.chinese: 她用枣熬制药膳(她用棗熬製藥膳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng zǎo áo zhì yào shàn.
examples.english: She uses jujubes to simmer medicinal cuisine.
